it.unimi.di.law.bubing

Class RuntimeConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unimi.di.law.bubing.RuntimeConfiguration

  • public class RuntimeConfiguration
extends Object
    Global data shared by all threads.

    All BUbiNG components must share a certain number of global variables, such as filters and pool of objects. A single instance of this class is created at agent construction time: it is used to pass around a single reference to global data.

    All fields in this class are either final or volatile, depending on whether they can be modified at runtime (usually by means of JMX methods in Agent).

    • Field Detail

      • FETCH_ROBOTS

        public static final boolean FETCH_ROBOTS
        Whether to fetch and use robots.txt. This value cannot be configured and it requires recompilation from the sources.

        You should be better knowing what you are doing if you change this to false.

      • crawlIsNew

        public final boolean crawlIsNew
        Whether this is a new crawl.

      • paused

        public volatile boolean paused
        Whether the crawler is currently paused. When this variable changes to false, a notifyAll() is issued on this runtime configuration.

      • stopping

        public volatile boolean stopping
        Whether the crawler is currently being stopping. The change of state to true is stable—this variable will never become false again.

      • DOTTED_ADDRESS

        public static final Pattern DOTTED_ADDRESS
        A pattern used to identify hosts specified directed via their address in dotted notation. Note the dot at the end. It covers both IPv6 addresses (where hexadecimal notation is accepted by default) and IPv4 addresses (where hexadecimal notation requires the 0x prefix on every single piece of the address).

    • Method Detail

      • addBlackListedIPv4

        public void addBlackListedIPv4(String spec)
                        throws ConfigurationException,
                               FileNotFoundException
        Adds a (or a set of) new IPv4 to the black list; the IPv4 can be specified directly or it can be a file (prefixed by file:).
        Parameters:
        spec - the specification (an IP address, or a file prefixed by file).
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException
        FileNotFoundException
